But what he was getting at (for what reason I don't know) was that if he
se=
t it on the commandline as an empty string he wanted to override that
with =
the default value.  The original poster has not yet responded to
any of the=
se responses, but I ask again, why would you ever want that
functionality?
=

=3Djason

On Mon, 2003-07-07 at 10:02, Ilja Preuss wrote:
> Timothy Wall w=
rote:
> > Here's one option, others are probably available using "if" and
>=
 > "condition": 
> > 
> > <target name=3D"default-value" unless=3D"testfile=
">
> > 	<property name=3D"testfile" value=3D"default-value"/>
> > </target>=

> 
> That's unnecessarily complicated. Simply use
> 
> 	<property name=3D"=
testfile" value=3D"default-value"/>
> 
> Properties can't be overridden, so=
 if it is already set (for example
> from the command line), it still would=
 have the original value.
> 
> Regards, Ilja
